reviewText: I have all his DVD's and this is the only one I am re=-selling.  It just isn't that funny.  And trust me, if you are a Republican, you will get very upset at the digs at Sarah Palin, Chrisine O'Donnell, and Michelle Bachman.  So three females get horribly dissed, as does the Tea Party.  Lewis may claim to dislike both parties, but it becomes very obvious where his sympathies lie.  I recommend any other DVD of his, just not this one.Not because of the politics alone, but it just was not very funny.
summary: Not as funny as the prior ones.

reviewText: Lewis Black isn't for everybody.  The language is a bit rough.  But, he is really very funny when he's serious.  I can't stand to watch more than one of his videos in a 24 hour period because it would depress me.  That's the definition of true humor.  Lewis Black is an angry Mark Twain.  We should all be just as angry as him, the world would be a better place.
Title: N/A

reviewText: For a 2012 cd to be focused on airport security, cell phones, the Tea Party and the inability of either political party to prevent terrorism shows how much Black is recycling his old material.  These routines are predictable and stale.  this is strictly for hardcore Black fans who can't can't enough of the same thing.

reviewText: Lewis Black "In God We Rust" is nothing short of brilliant and it might just be his greatest performance ever. Pay no attention to the 1 star reviews. They are pure nonsense and were probably left by Michelle Bachman and Sarah Palin who Lewis dresses down with ease. Anyone who could watch this DVD and not laugh their butts off needs shock therapy. If you're a huge Lewis Black fan don't delay buying this DVD. Don't just sit there DO IT NOW!!!!

reviewText: I was at this show in Minneapolis, and have seen Lewis Black in concert many times here and in Las Vegas.  He never disappoints.  I think the material he has on his current tour is better, but even so this was a great night.  Highly recommended, and even more importantly - go see him in concert if you get a chance.  What a blast.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have every previous Lewis Black DVD.  They are very entertaining.  I don't know what happened during this performance.  It was not funny at all.  It was painful to watch.  It seemed as if his remaining remnants of sanity were running away from him.  If you are a Lewis Black fan, it will break your heart to watch this.  Do yourself a favor....do not watch this...hold on to all your positive memories of Lewis Black.  This performance will leave only negative imprints.
summary: Lewis Black was GREAT in the past..,

reviewText: Living in Minnesota, I was extra pleased that Lewis Black filmed this while here. Make sure you watch the special features so you can see a couple of stuck up people get booed out. Typical Lewis Black with lots of cursing but typical Lewis Black is amazing to me. Warning: this review was written by a HUGE fan.

reviewText: This is getting tiresome. Lewis Black used to be at the cutting edge of comedy. Pick up any of his albums between 2000 and 2005. His animated and psychotic rants will have you in stitches. During the past few years we've seen increasingly unfunny releases from Lewis in both The Carnegie Hall Performance (2006) and Stark Raving Black (2009), which were both recorded in large venues.Sorry, but certain comics aren't suited for the big stage. Lewis is one of them. Even Black himself quipped during "Carnegie Hall..." that "I don't belong here and you don't belong here". It was a joke, of course, but it couldn't have been further from the truth. Lewis is ten times funnier when he performs in a club, which is an intimate setting that provides timing nuances that are perfectly suited to his style of comedy.On "In God We Rust" Lewis seems to be going through the phases in a sort of unruffled, reflective mood. The calm moments are dull, dull, dull. The loud moments are - as you'd expect - flashes of rage exploding in a fit of unbridled anger. In the past, these fits of fury sort of ebbed and flowed during his routine, keeping you on edge, here they come off as just mere loud moments. Yelling for yelling's sake.There are micro moments of magic here, especially towards the end. The bit about Farmville is good. The rest of the material is just painful to watch. There are people who still enjoy the comedy of Lewis Black. Good for them.  This is where I get off, I'm afraid.

reviewText: This is a really entertaining DVD. Lewis Black is so capable of shaking our senses by just the pointed wiggly index finger stabbing the air. His take on issues of the day or things that just happen in life turn pretty clever when filtered through his mind. He has developed a terrific curmudgeonly persona that really works well for him on stage.I've seen him in person, on TV specials and on DVD. He never disappoints. Good DVD.
summary: Lewis Black Rocks or Throws Verbal Rocks Perhaps
